pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.4: The sub-chapter on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.5: 26. The training rule on sitting with clasped knees
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were clasping their knees while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.3.1: “‘I will not clasp my knees while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.4: One should not clasp one’s knees while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, clasps his knees with his hands or with a cloth while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.15: The sixth training rule is finished.
